SENT.plain: A 34-year-old woman was admitted on the 10th day post partum complaining of loss of strength in the left arm and headache
The next day she started having seizures
Although the clinical picture suggested sinus thrombosis, initially a CT scan showed no abnormalities
The diagnosis of sinus sagittalis superior thrombosis was finally made by means of arteriography
The patient was treated successfully with anticoagulants and recovered without sequelae
